channel.title: African Journal of Oral Health Sciences - Most Recent Articles
channel.description: view the most recent articles from African Journal of Oral Health Sciences

item.title: Pregnancy epulis: Case series among pregnant women in Kaduna, Northern Nigeria
item.description: The aim of this work is to report the clinical presentation and management of pregnancy epulis (PE) among pregnant women that attended ante-natal clinic in Barau Dikko Teaching Hospital, Kaduna, Northern, Nigeria. Three hundred and twenty self-administered, structured questionnaires were administered to pregnant women that attended ante-natal clinic in Barau Dikko Teaching Hospital, Kaduna. ...

item.title: Computer-aided and 3d printing technologies; new frontiers in reconstructive surgery
item.description: Computer-aided and 3D printing technologies have recently become accepted standard of care protocol for preoperative surgical planning and in the design pros-thesis.

item.title: The potential of using 3d printed patient specific models in reconstructive surgery of the mandible –review paper
item.description: Additive manufacturing, also known as 3D printing is a manufacturing technique whose process involves laying down of material, one layer on top of the other such that a solid object is formed. Its capability to produce objects of complicated geometrical shapes (otherwise unachievable by traditional manufacturing techniques) within a relatively short time and without extra tooling has made it...

item.title: Root curvature in the maxillary first permanent molars in a Kenyan population
item.description: Objective; To determine the root curvature in the maxillary first permanent molars. Methodology; A total of 187 maxillary molars were collected from male and female patients aged between10 and 40 years. The teeth were orientated in their anatomical positions on a calibrated graph paper and the root curvature determined with reference to the long axis of root from the bifurcation. Results; Ma...

item.title: Debilitating lymphangiomatous macroglossia-case report
item.description: Objective; Lymphangiomatous macroglossia in children though uncommon may cause significant morbidity which maybe functional or developmental when untreated and also presents a significant surgical challenge when trying to balance complete surgical excision and maintenance of contour and function. Case report; We report a case of extensive tongue lymphangioma in which surgical excision was pe...
